item.description:
No rest for the weary - we've finished our NH 48 and are now on to our NE 100 Highest points.  PATN is a bushwhack on the NE 100 list.  Bob & Geri have graciously offered their bushwhacking experience to help us bag this peak!

This climb is estimated to take 4.5 hours at 5 miles round-trip

------------------------- 

Be prepared for cool and potentially poor weather conditions. DO NOT WEAR COTTON OR DENIM. This is a BUSHWHACK, so please dress appropriately.  If you have questions about how to prepare or how to dress, ask them in advance.  Come prepared to stay dry!!

Answers to FAQs

  • This IS NOT a traverse, but we WILL need to carpool to another location due to limited parking availability at the "trailhead" for PATN.
  • We will meet in the parking lot for Beaver Brook Trail.
  • Sunset will be at  about 6:25 pm.
  • This hike will NOT be very exposed.  
  • We will NOT pass a hut on this climb.
  • Water sources appear to be *very* limited on this trail
  • Headlamps are not required, but strongly suggested as a safety precaution.  Always be prepared to come out in the dark if necessary.
  • We will START AND FINISH TOGETHER. If you cannot hold your speed down to match that of the group (if necessary), this is not the hike for you.   We  require participants to wait at trail junctions, major water crossings and summits so that the group can exchange information and reset their pace.
  • I (Kate K) am NOT a speedy hiker, but I do keep a steady pace.  I'm doing about book time these days.
  • If the conditions are prohibitive, I have no qualms about turning around. The mountain will be there another day.  I would like you to be around for another day too.
  • My hikes are always dog friendly, but please know the limits, abilities and behavior of your dog(s) & bring plenty of water.
  • I will watch the weather carefully and post weather updates during the week leading up to the hike. I rely on NOAA and MWObs for my forecasts.
  • I will provide attendees with my cell phone number in advance of the hike.

 

Most of the payoff comes in the form of great views & enjoying the outdoors.  If the weather looks like it will be miserable, including rain, I will reschedule. Please plan accordingly.

RSVP Questions are NOT optional - If you do not provide me with a phone number to try and contact you on the morning of the hike (if necessary), we will NOT wait for you at the trailhead.

 

Totals  
--------  
4.5 miles  
5 hours


DISCLAIMER (SHAMELESSLY PLAGERIZED FROM ANOTHER MEETUP HIKER): MY ROLE AS ORGANIZER IN THIS HIKE IS SOCIAL. I AM NOT TRAINED TO BE A GUIDE, NOR HAVE I RECEIVED TRAINING OR INSTRUCTION IN HIKING SAFETY. WHILE I TRY TO HEAD OFF SOME OF THE PROBLEMS I HAVE SEEN (OR EXPERIENCED OR EVEN CAUSED) IN THE PAST, MY UNDERSTANDING IS THAT YOU WILL TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY. IF MY DISAPPEARANCE DURING THIS TRIP WOULD CAUSE YOU MORE THAN ANNOYANCE AND INCONVENIENCE, THIS IS NOT THE TRIP FOR YOU. THERE ARE ALWAYS RISKS IN HIKING IN THE MOUNTAINS. IF YOU ARE NOT CONFIDENT THAT YOU UNDERSTAND THE RISKS, PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP (or change your RSVP to no). I HAVE NOT CLIMBED THIS PEAK BEFORE AND I HAVE DONE ALL MY RESEARCH VIA GUIDEBOOKS, INTERNET AND ADVICE FROM OTHER HIKERS, SO IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOME INFORMATION IS NOT ACCURATE. I AM PERFECTLY CAPABLE OF MAKING STUPID OR MINDLESS MISTAKES, SO PLEASE DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH AND COME PREPARED WITH APPROPRIATE KNOWLEDGE, EQUIPMENT AND JUDGMENT.
item.how_to_find_us: MAP to the meeting spot - http://rbhayes.net/beaverbrook.jpg 6.6 miles from exit 35 on Rte 93 - Beaver Brook Picnic area is on Rte 3 in Twin Mountain
item.name: NE 100 Highest: Peak Above the Nubble (PATN) - Bushwhack
